Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/186
item.itunes:subtitle: How “cancel culture,” while prominent now, has always been a part of our human history.
item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 185: (Part 1) Thought Work and “Cancel Culture”: A Conversation with Advanced Certification in Feminist Coaching Graduates Amber Taylor, Brig Johnson & Brenda Lomeli
item.itunes:title: (Part 1) Thought Work and “Cancel Culture”: A Conversation with Advanced Certification in Feminist Coaching Graduates Amber Taylor, Brig Johnson & Brenda Lomeli
item.description:
Whether you call it call-in culture, consequence culture or "cancel culture,” you likely have an opinion about the current online accountability discourse. On this special two-part series, I invited three of my colleagues and advanced certification students - Master Coach Brenda Lomeli, Master Coach Brig Johnson, and Clutch Coach Amber Taylor - to discuss the range of actions and conversations that get lumped together, sometimes unhelpfully, in this movement. Join us for the first part of the conversation in which we explore accountability in the context of white supremacy, racial and social justice, online social dynamics, and psychology.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/185

item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 184: Black & White Thinking
item.itunes:title: Black & White Thinking
item.description:
Do you believe that you have to quit your job in order to take any action on starting your dream business? That you can only be happy if you have a very specific kind of life? That you have to cut someone out of your life because they did something you dislike? These are all examples of black and white thinking, one of the most pervasive - and limiting - ways of looking at the world. Tune in to learn how embracing shades of grey will open up your life and expand your impact in the world.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/184

item.title: UFYB 183: QA: Phobias, Neutralizing Circumstances & Taking Ownership of What You Want
item.itunes:title: QA: Phobias, Neutralizing Circumstances & Taking Ownership of What You Want
item.description:
Do you have a phobia or fear that you want to get under control? Do you want more out of life, but struggle with indecision and confusion about how to change? Have you ever wondered why some people thrive in certain environments, while others have to coach themselves a ton just to make it through the day? In today’s Listener Q&A episode, I’ll explore these questions and more.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/183

item.title: UFYB 182: Greatest Hits Vol 5. What About Sexism?
item.itunes:title: Greatest Hits Vol 5. What About Sexism?
item.description:
Are your efforts to challenge sexism, racism, and other oppressive systems leaving you frustrated, overwhelmed, and burnt out? Tune in to this week’s Greatest Hits episode to learn how to use coaching tools to create social change without draining yourself or feeling angry all the time. When you learn how to liberate yourself from fear and judgment, you create endless energy to liberate the world.

item.title: UFYB 181: Thought Work After Abortion: An Interview with Amanda Kingsley
item.itunes:title: Thought Work After Abortion: An Interview with Amanda Kingsley
item.description:
Because discussions about abortion tend to be so polarized, it can be difficult to unpack your thoughts and feelings about the decision, even though more than 1/3 of Americans will have an abortion in their lifetime. This week, I’m joined by Amanda Kingsley, a Certified Life Coach, Doula and host of the Speaking Light Into Abortion podcast, to explore the prevailing thoughts many women have about their abortions - and how to let go of unnecessary pain and suffering around the decision.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/181

item.title: UFYB 180: Philosophy = Self Help + Why It Matters
item.itunes:title: Philosophy = Self Help + Why It Matters
item.description:
Do you ever feel shame scanning the self-help aisle of the bookstore? Do you roll your eyes when you see life coaches offering self-help courses on your IG/FB feed? It may surprise you, but the embarrassment or shame you feel toward self help is 100% internalized patriarchy. In today’s episode, you will learn why self help has more in common with ancient philosophical traditions than with self-indulgent spa trips, and why your own self-help practice is so important.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/180

item.title: UFYB 178: Greatest Hits Vol 4. The Infinite 1%
item.itunes:title: Greatest Hits Vol 4. The Infinite 1%
item.description:
You may think you aren’t close to achieving a goal until you’re 99% of the way there and the finish line is in view. But actually, the biggest distance you can cover is in taking your first few steps toward your goal. Going from inaction to action is INFINITE growth. Once you’ve done that? You can just repeat the process until you reach your destination. In this Greatest Hits episode, you will learn how minuscule steps create exponential growth.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/178

item.title: UFYB 177: Best Teachings from Clutch College - Goals, Results, and Your Future Self
item.itunes:title: Best Teachings from Clutch College - Goals, Results, and Your Future Self
item.description:
Do you torture yourself on the way to a goal, in the hopes that you’ll feel different when you “get there?” Do you think of goals as shiny gold coins to collect in order to feel better about yourself? Do you undermine or discount your accomplishments? Tune into this episode for some mind-blowing wisdom from a live event I hosted earlier this year. You will learn how to reframe everything from your relationship to goal-setting, and learn how to develop the single most important skill to uplevel your growth.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/177

item.itunes:title: Tarot Cards, Thought Work & Mysticism with Jessica Dore
item.description:
Want to learn what thought work and tarot have in common? In this week’s special episode, I have invited my friend, philosopher, writer, and tarotist Jessica Dore onto the podcast to discuss all things thought work and tarot...and to give me a mini-reading! Jessica has a background in cognitive and behavioral therapy, and uses the art of mysticism to help her clients gain a deeper understanding of themselves.

item.itunes:title: QA: Business Building Thoughts & Getting Negative Feedback at Work

item.title: Welcome to UFYB: Start Here!
item.description:
Welcome to UnF*ck Your Brain! This podcast teaches you concrete, effective, mind-blowing tools that you can use to reduce anxiety, improve your productivity, dial-up your self-confidence, and dial down your insecurity and people-pleasing.

I’m Kara Loewentheil, a master certified life coach with degrees from Harvard and Yale – and a former high-powered career working for women’s rights. I’ve taken all the best neuroscience, evolutionary psychology, and coaching tools I know and combined them with feminist theory to create a set of powerful practices and life-changing ideas that will teach you how to liberate yourself from the inside out.

You can be the strong, empowered, confident woman you’ve always wanted to be – you just have to learn how to clear away all the negative self-talk and messages from the patriarchy that are keeping you small.

So let’s not sit here just talking about it – because I’m all about teaching you how to take smart action! You can start anywhere you like, every episode stands alone – just scroll and find a topic that calls you, and hit play. Join the feminist mindset revolution - your life will never be the same.

item.title: UFYB 174: Greatest Hits Vol 3. Radical Self-Love & Self-Care
item.itunes:title: Greatest Hits Vol 3. Radical Self-Love & Self-Care
item.description:
We live in a society that teaches women to put themselves last, and the more marginalized identities you live in, the more ways you are told you’re not good enough or worthy of taking up space. For those who live in marginalized identities, self-love is a radical political act that enables us to claim our worth and challenge oppressive belief systems. Tune into today’s Greatest Hits episode to learn how to cultivate radical self-love and how to use it to transform the world.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/174

item.title: UFYB 173: Greatest Hits Vol 2. Dating, Perfectionism, & Anxious Attachment
item.itunes:title: Greatest Hits Vol 2. Dating, Perfectionism, & Anxious Attachment
item.description:
Do you lay awake at night obsessing over why a new date or partner took 3 hours to respond to your text instead of their usual 30 minutes? Or maybe you start to feel avoidant when a new partner wants to hang out too much, and worry about losing independence in a relationship? Whatever your attachment style, this Greatest Hits episode will help you discover how it may be affecting your relationships - and how to use thought work to feel secure in your relationships.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/173

item.title: UFYB 172: Productivity, Self-Worth, and the Industrial Revolution: A Conversation with Simone Seol
item.itunes:title: Productivity, Self-Worth, and the Industrial Revolution: A Conversation with Simone Seol
item.description:
Do you tie your self-worth to how productive you are? You know the signs: Never feeling like you’re doing enough, criticizing yourself for being “lazy” or “unmotivated.” If you feel stuck in a cycle of burnout and self-criticism, this episode’s for you. On today’s podcast, I join business coach Simone Seol to explore cultural beliefs about productivity - and how shifting your own beliefs about productivity can help you compound your results.

Get full show notes and more information here:https://unfuckyourbrain.com/172

item.title: UFYB 171: Greatest Hits Vol 1. Perfectionist Fantasies + Tomorrow Thinking
item.itunes:title: Greatest Hits Vol 1. Perfectionist Fantasies + Tomorrow Thinking
item.description:
Do you believe that if you just got that new job title, got married, or achieved any other fill-in-the-blank-accomplishment, you’d be happy and confident? And then do you create unrealistic plans to achieve that goal and abandon them entirely when you inevitably stumble in the execution? Tune into this Greatest Hits episode to learn how your perfectionist fantasies are holding you back - and how to build integrity with yourself (and accomplish your goals) by letting them go.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/171

item.title: UFYB 170: Weight Loss, the Diet Industry, and Self-Love: A Conversation with Corinne Crabtree
item.itunes:title: Weight Loss, the Diet Industry, and Self-Love: A Conversation with Corinne Crabtree
item.description:
It’s no secret that I am an anti-diet coach. On today’s podcast, I’ll introduce you to my dear friend - and wildly successful weight loss coach - Corinne Crabtree. We’ll dive into our shared qualms with the diet industry, explore how Corinne holds space for unconditional self-love and body diversity in how she teaches weight loss, and discuss the top three lessons we’ve learned from each other.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/170

item.title: UFYB 169: Misconceptions about Thought Work & Mindset Coaching
item.itunes:title: Misconceptions about Thought Work & Mindset Coaching
item.description:
There are a lot of misunderstandings about life coaching out there - that coaching is about gaslighting and spiritual bypassing, that it’s about learning how to “fix” yourself on your own, that it’s only for privileged people. In today’s podcast, I break down the 5 biggest misconceptions about mindset coaching to reveal what coaching is really about: taking control of your experience of the world and generating more love and compassion for yourself and others.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/169

item.title: UFYB 168: Not Normal - Conformity, Safety, and Fear of Standing Out
item.itunes:title: Not Normal - Conformity, Safety, and Fear of Standing Out
item.description:
Most women feel immense pressure to be “normal.” We evolved to conform for our literal safety, and patriarchy has socialized us to fit in, to defer to the needs of others, to not challenge the dominant social norms. But in order to create an extraordinary life, you have to learn how to leave normal behind and be YOURSELF, fully, weird and wonderful as you are. Learn how in today’s episode.

Get full show notes and more information here:https://unfuckyourbrain.com/168
item.content:encoded:

But in order to create an extraordinary life, you have to learn how to leave normal behind and be YOURSELF, fully, weird and wonderful as you are. Learn how in today’s episode.

Get full show notes and more information here:https://unfuckyourbrain.com/168
item.itunes:subtitle: How conformity manifests and why it’s a problem.
item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 167: Belief, Confidence, and Shattering Glass Ceilings: A Conversation with Brenda Lomeli
item.itunes:title: Belief, Confidence, and Shattering Glass Ceilings: A Conversation with Brenda Lomeli
item.description:
Why is it so valuable to set audacious goals, and how would it feel to have full confidence you could create exactly what you want this year? Find out in today’s podcast with Master Certified Coach and holistic nutritionist Brenda Lomeli, who has changed lives and shattered glass ceilings on the way to accepting herself fully. We’ll share 3 things we’ve learned from each other, how diversity benefits the entire coaching industry, and why it’s sometimes good to feel nauseous.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/167

item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 166: Perfectionism & Achieving Impossible Goals
item.itunes:title: Perfectionism & Achieving Impossible Goals
item.description:
Are you a perfectionist who wants to do something big? Most of the tools life coaches use to help their clients go after big goals don’t take perfectionist thought patterns into account, which sets you up to fail before you’ve even started. Tune into today’s episode to learn how to work WITH your brain and blow your f*cking mind.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/166

item.title: Bonus: How to Make & Keep Resolutions
item.itunes:title: Bonus: How to Make & Keep Resolutions
item.description:
The year is almost over, which means a lot of people are making ambitious resolutions that they will fully abandon by February 1. Tune into today’s bonus podcast to learn how to use the concepts of constraint and massive action to break the cycle of abandoned resolutions and achieve any goal you make for yourself this year.

Get full show notes and more information here:https://unfuckyourbrain.com/make-keep-resolutions/

item.title: UFYB 165: Saying No
item.itunes:title: Saying No
item.description:
Do you agree to do things you’d prefer not to because you’re worried it would be rude or uncomfortable to refuse? Whether you take on extra obligations at work or make subtle concessions at home to “keep the peace,” your discomfort with saying no is likely impacting every area of your life. Tune into today’s episode to learn how you can say YES to yourself by getting better at saying NO to others.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/165

item.title: UFYB 164: Money Mindset, Safety, and Being Yourself: A Conversation with Stacey Boehman
item.itunes:title: Money Mindset, Safety, and Being Yourself: A Conversation with Stacey Boehman
item.description:
This week, I invited fellow life coach, friend, and sales savant Stacey Boehman onto the podcast. Stacey is a Master Certified Coach who teaches other coaches how to sell and make money. Tune in as we explore the top three lessons we’ve learned from each other, where security and safety come from, and Stacey’s history of deer-related trauma (yes, you read that right).

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/164

item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 163: Loving Lightly
item.itunes:title: Loving Lightly
item.description:
Do you get attached to the things you love? Many people wear their attachment as a badge of honor, thinking that loving something deeply means fearing its loss. In this episode, I’ll teach you why loving lightly - without attachment - is so revolutionary. You will learn how to love others lightly by committing to your OWN happiness, knowing that you will always love yourself and your life, no matter what.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/163
item.content:encoded:

item.title: UFYB 162: Soulmates, Friendship, and Coaching Breakthroughs: A Conversation with Rachel Hart
item.itunes:title: Soulmates, Friendship, and Coaching Breakthroughs: A Conversation with Rachel Hart
item.description:
What happens when two coaches fall in (platonic) love? You’ll find out in this episode, where I’ll introduce you to life coach - and best friend of mine - Rachel Hart. You’ll get a window into how our friendship has transformed both of our lives, and find out the three most valuable lessons we’ve learned from each other.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/162

item.title: UFYB 161: Anticipatory Stress (Insomnia, Public Speaking, etc.)
item.itunes:title: Anticipatory Stress (Insomnia, Public Speaking, etc.)
item.description:
If you have insomnia, do you spend so much energy dreading the possibility of waking up at night that you literally can’t fall asleep? This is a perfect example of anticipatory stress, the stress we feel in anticipation of anything we label “bad.” It’s also the main source of our suffering in any situation we dread. Tune in to learn four simple steps you can take to feel calmer even if what you fear comes to pass.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/161
item.content:encoded:

This is a perfect example of anticipatory stress, the stress we feel in anticipation of anything we label “bad.” It’s also the main source of our suffering in any situation we dread. Tune in to learn four simple steps you can take to feel calmer even if what you fear comes to pass.

item.itunes:subtitle: 4 steps to handling any form of anticipatory stress.
item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 160: Your Self Story & DEI Update
item.itunes:title: Your Self Story & DEI Update
item.description:
Do you define yourself by what you have or haven’t achieved in the past? If you’re in debt, do you think of yourself as someone who’s bad with money? If you’re perpetually single, do you think you aren’t capable of love? Most of us judge ourselves because we want to change - but doing so actually PREVENTS us from changing. If you want to change your life, you have to start by changing your beliefs about yourself.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/160
item.content:encoded:

If you’re perpetually single, do you think you aren’t capable of love? Most of us judge ourselves because we want to change - but doing so actually PREVENTS us from changing. If you want to change your life, you have to start by changing your beliefs about yourself.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/160
item.itunes:subtitle: Why dwelling on your past failures won’t motivate change.
item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 159: You Are Not the Reference Point
item.itunes:title: You Are Not the Reference Point
item.description:
How often do you look at someone else’s behavior and think, “If I were them, I’d do that differently”? This may seem like an innocent habit, but it can wreak havoc on your relationships and stagnate your growth. In today’s episode, learn how to let go of your judgments and generate curiosity, compassion, and love for those around you.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/159
item.content:encoded:
How often do you look at someone else’s behavior and think, “If I were them, I’d do that differently”? item.itunes:subtitle: Why believing we are the reference point is the single biggest obstacle to clear communication and unconditional love.
item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 158: Giving Yourself Permission
item.itunes:title: Giving Yourself Permission
item.description:
Do you ever notice a low hum of discomfort and anxiety when you do things that someone, somewhere along the line, told you that you shouldn’t do? Like, say, eat carbs or take a nap. In this episode, I’ll teach you a simple brain hack that will instantly dissolve your guilt and discomfort. Get ready to take control of your life and experience WHATEVER you choose with more ease, relaxation, and pleasure.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/158

item.title: UFYB 157: Election Emotions (2020 Politics & Beyond)
item.itunes:title: Election Emotions (2020 Politics & Beyond)
item.description:
Are you feeling anxious and worried about the upcoming US presidential election? Our brains are wired to fixate on anything in the future that they perceive as a potential “threat,” but you don’t have to let your fear consume you. In this episode, I’ll teach you how to wrangle your brain when you are spinning out about the election (or any other future-focused event you’re stressed about).

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/157
item.content:encoded:

item.itunes:subtitle: How to stop living in fear of the future.
item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 156: Victim Blaming & Self-Shaming
item.itunes:title: Victim Blaming & Self-Shaming
item.description:
A lot of people think that “your thoughts create your feelings” means they should blame themselves if they’re struggling, even if they’re dealing with the effects of trauma. Listen to this episode to learn how to ACCEPT what you’re feeling rather than judge it, and why applying this radical acceptance to your life will set you free.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/156
item.content:encoded:

item.itunes:subtitle: What is happening when people misunderstand thought work as victim blaming.

item.title: UFYB 155: Resourcefulness vs. Resourcelessness
item.itunes:title: Resourcefulness vs. Resourcelessness
item.description:
Do you know how to solve your own problems? Resourcefulness is one of the most important qualities you need to live an incredible life, but many of us have brains that just throw up their metaphorical hands and want to die whenever the smallest hurdle arises. Learn why resourcefulness is so important, and how you can develop this critical skill, in today’s episode.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/155
item.content:encoded:

item.title: UFYB 154: Ghost Patterns - Anxiety, Fixation & Survival
item.itunes:title: Ghost Patterns - Anxiety, Fixation & Survival
item.description:
Is your brain haunting you? Most of us experience ghosts of old anxious thought patterns even after we’ve used coaching to feel more confident and secure. In today’s episode, I’ll teach you why these sparks of anxiety are so persistent, and what you can do the next time you experience a “haunting.”

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/154

item.title: UFYB 153: Copenhagen & Croissants
item.itunes:title: Copenhagen & Croissants
item.description:
You would never go to a toy store for a gala dress, so why do you stay with someone who’s afraid of commitment, when you’re looking for a life partner? Why do you seek validation from a parent, when they’ve never once approved of your choices? In this episode, I’ll teach you how to stop seeking validation, love, and approval from people who will never give it to you - and how to give it to yourself, instead.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/153

item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 152: Hope & Commitment
item.itunes:title: Hope & Commitment
item.description:
Are you feeling hopeless, afraid, despondent, or angry at the recent passing of Ruth Bader Ginsburg? In today’s podcast, I will teach you how to take hopeful action even when you aren’t FEELING hopeful, by using the coaching model to generate feelings of commitment. Hope feels good when it happens to arrive, but commitment will create a revolution.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/152

item.title: UFYB 151: Maximalism
item.itunes:title: Maximalism
item.description:
Do you wish your life looked more like those minimalist Instagram homes full of light and clean lines and constraint? In today’s podcast episode, you will learn about the patriarchal underpinnings of minimalism and why I embrace MAXIMALISM instead. Tune in to get a taste of what life could look like if you stopped restricting yourself and gave yourself permission to be as colorful, loud, and abundant as you wanted.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/151
item.content:encoded:

item.itunes:subtitle: How minimalism can be a valuable way to live your life, and what maximalism means to me and why I find joy in it.
item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 150: Compromising: How and When
item.itunes:title: Compromising: How and When
item.description:
Women are socialized to compromise our needs and happiness behind the needs of family, friends, even strangers. At the same time, we’ve also experienced situations where compromise is helpful and growth-promoting. In this podcast episode, you will learn a few simple questions to ask yourself so that you will always know when to compromise and when to stand firm.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/150
item.content:encoded:

item.title: UFYB 149: Diet Culture, Internalized Oppression, & Fat Bias - My Story
item.itunes:title: Diet Culture, Internalized Oppression, & Fat Bias - My Story
item.description:
Most of us are so steeped in fatphobia that we don’t even realize it exists…and yet it impacts every aspect of our lives, from what we think about our bodies to what our doctors tell us when we are sick. Listen in to learn how I used thought work to overcome my own internalized fatphobia, and how you can set yourself free, too.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/149

item.title: UFYB 148: Intuition
item.itunes:title: Intuition
item.description:
Listen in this week to discover why the framing of intuition as something you use to categorize an experience doesn’t serve you, how it gets confused with feelings of anxiety, and the role of cognitive bias here. You need to examine the assumption that you should act on something without question if it’s coming from your intuition, and I’m guiding you through this process today.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/148
item.content:encoded:
Listen in this week to discover why the framing of intuition as something you use to categorize an experience doesn’t serve you, how it gets confused with feelings of anxiety, and the role of cognitive bias here. You need to examine the assumption that you should act on something without question if it’s coming from your intuition, and I’m guiding you through this process today.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/148
item.itunes:subtitle: Why, most of the time, what you are calling intuition or a gut feeling is not actually that.
item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.itunes:title: Listener Q&A Vol. 17
item.description:
Listen in today to get a taste of what it’s like to join The Clutch where I coach every single week on topics like body image and thought work. I’m doing a listener Q&A to coach on some of the most frequent questions I get sent. If you’re loving what you’re learning here and want a chance to have your questions addressed, come join us there!

item.title: UFYB 146: Using TW Against Yourself
item.itunes:title: Using TW Against Yourself
item.description:
Listen in this week to discover if you might be using thought work against yourself. There are two main ways that I see this play out very commonly, and I’m showing you why using thought work within these contexts can sometimes bring you awareness, but ultimately they are longer paths to getting to that point.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/146

item.title: UFYB 145: Mental Flexibility
item.itunes:title: Mental Flexibility
item.description:
Join me this week as I show you what mental flexibility is and why this skill is crucial in thought work. I’m outlining the irony that exists in resisting being challenged or in trying on a new contradictory thought, and why accepting, allowing, and holding space for two conflicting beliefs is what will help you move into alignment with the thing you want to become or have.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/145
item.content:encoded:
Join me this week as I show you what mental flexibility is and why this skill is crucial in thought work. I’m outlining the irony that exists in resisting being challenged or in trying on a new contradictory thought, and why accepting, allowing, and holding space for two conflicting beliefs is what will help you move into alignment with the thing you want to become or have.

item.itunes:subtitle: What mental flexibility is and why it’s so important to have.
item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 144: Get Out of Other People's Models
item.itunes:title: Get Out of Other People's Models
item.description:
Join me on the podcast today as I show you when it’s useful to think about other people’s models, when it’s not, and why. Making your mental and emotional state contingent upon what other people might be thinking, feeling, or doing is useless and a waste of energy, and my goal is to show you that you never have to know what someone else is thinking to decide what you are going to think.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/144
item.content:encoded:
Join me on the podcast today as I show you when it’s useful to think about other people’s models, when it’s not, and why. item.title: UFYB 143: Radical Self-Love & Self-Care
item.itunes:title: Radical Self-Love & Self-Care
item.description:
Join me this week as I show you the power that lies in practicing radical self-love and exquisite self-care, why it is a radical subversive act, and how liberation from an oppressive ideology is an inside job. Radical self-love is where change has to start, and it’s a tool that will give you the emotional resources and mental freedom to transform your life.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/143
item.content:encoded:

item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 142: Are You Underacting or Overacting?
item.itunes:title: Are You Underacting or Overacting?
item.description:
Join me today as I share the nuances that come with being an overactor and an underactor, and the antidotes for each type of behavior. Both types are self-critical and often feel miserable about their goals, and I’ll be showing you how balanced action is the key to your own growth and appreciation for the journey, no matter what you may be working on.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/142
item.content:encoded:
Join me today as I share the nuances that come with being an overactor and an underactor, and the antidotes for each type of behavior. Both types are self-critical and often feel miserable about their goals, and I’ll be showing you how balanced action is the key to your own growth and appreciation for the journey, no matter what you may be working on.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/142
item.itunes:subtitle: Why you are able to change your thought patterns about anything if you’re motivated to do so.
item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 141: Closure
item.itunes:title: Closure
item.description:
Join me today as I show you what true closure is and how to get it. I’m outlining two things that many people believe will bring them closure if they had it, why these things are just lies our brains feed us, and the only thing that is really in your way of being happy right now.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/141
item.content:encoded:
Join me today as I show you what true closure is and how to get it. I’m outlining two things that many people believe will bring them closure if they had it, why these things are just lies our brains feed us, and the only thing that is really in your way of being happy right now.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/141
item.itunes:subtitle: Why you don’t need interaction with other people to get closure.

item.title: UFYB 140: Selling Yourself on Your Thoughts
item.itunes:title: Selling Yourself on Your Thoughts
item.description:
Join me on the podcast today as I show you why you have to sell yourself and commit to watering, nurturing, and growing the new thoughts you’ve planted in your brain to make your visions and dreams come true. You’ll inevitably have mixed results along the way, but that’s just part of the process.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/140

item.title: UFYB 139: Let's Talk About Sex Vol. 2
item.itunes:title: Let's Talk About Sex Vol. 2
item.description:
Today I'm showing you how thought work can be used in various scenarios to improve your sex life and your physical experience of sex. It’s not all biology, your thoughts have a huge impact on the sexual dynamic between you and your partner, and your experience of sex overall.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/139

item.title: UFYB 138: Let's Talk About Sex Vol. 1
item.itunes:title: Let's Talk About Sex Vol. 1
item.description:
Listen in this week as I share a technique that I’ve found effective in connecting to your sexuality by embodying your own desire. This can feel uncomfortable and it may bring up strong emotions for you, and that’s totally okay and normal. The great thing about this work is that you can take it as slow as you want, without anyone else being involved.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/138

item.title: UFYB 137: Defensiveness & Shame
item.itunes:title: Defensiveness & Shame
item.description:
Join me today as I show you what is actually happening when you feel defensive, and how shame feeds into this feeling and prevents you from consciously digging into your thoughts. Anxiety, shame, and defensiveness are signals for you to get curious, and cluing yourself in and asking the right questions will allow you to see where you might be out of alignment and make changes.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/137
item.content:encoded:

item.title: The Role of Thought Work in Living with Racism: A Conversation with Erika Royal (UPDATED)
item.itunes:title: The Role of Thought Work in Living with Racism: A Conversation with Erika Royal (UPDATED)
item.description:
Join us today as Erika shares her experience of navigating racism and her own journey of finding her voice to speak up and have difficult conversations as a black woman. You’ll hear how learning the coaching tools has impacted her life, and she illustrates the nuances of how she uses thought work to process her experiences, allow her emotions, and take action.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/junebonus2

item.title: UFYB 136: Anti-Racist Thought Work for White People
item.itunes:title: Anti-Racist Thought Work for White People
item.description:
Listen in today to discover the most productive ways for you to be an ally and to make anti-racism a practice. I’m showing you how to use thought work to start questioning your belief systems. There is no one right way to do this, and creating guilt and shame for yourself never results in transformation. 

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/136
item.content:encoded:

item.title: TW & Anti-Racism Resources + Free Coaching Call
item.itunes:title: TW & Anti-Racism Resources + Free Coaching Call
item.description:
What I think the role of thought work is in moments like this and how we can use it to process challenging times and create change in the world.

I also address how white people can use thought work to get curious about our thoughts and to get honest about our own internalized racism. If you are a white person listening to this, I invite you to stay with me on this episode and to trust what I’m saying today so that it can be a tool for individual liberation and help us contribute to social change.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/junebonus1

item.title: UFYB 135: Embrace the Suck
item.itunes:title: Embrace the Suck
item.description:
Today I'm sharing two big reasons why you need to embrace the suck. We’re going to experience it at least 50% of the time anyway, so why not accept that and move through the world knowing that it sometimes sucks to be a human? There is no perfect way to do this, and willing to stay present is a skill that will help you embrace the other 50% that is full of joy and happiness.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/135
item.content:encoded:

item.itunes:title: A Year of Thought Work Vol. 3 - Money, Money, Money
item.description:
This week, I want you to hear from some of my Clutch students who have used thought work to change their relationship with money. I love that they each bring a unique perspective on this topic, coming from various fields and industries, and every single of them has used what they’ve learned in The Clutch to create a more abundant financial mindset.

item.title: UFYB 133: Your Financial Value & Worth
item.itunes:title: Your Financial Value & Worth
item.description:
This week I illuminate the importance of this work in feeling secure in your moral value and worth, and why you, as a human, have inherent and intrinsic value just for existing. It’s no surprise that women tend to experience a lot of emotional drama when it comes to financial conversations or discussing their economic worth, and I’m untangling all of this on the podcast today.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/133.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: UFYB 132: Pleasure First Principle
item.itunes:title: Pleasure First Principle
item.description:
You can experience pleasure whenever and however you want, without permission from anyone else. I’m diving into how women don’t spend time on things we truly love, and why we’re not encouraged to take real pleasure seriously. Taking the time to create and experience pleasure is the best thing you can do for yourself, and I’m showing you how today.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/132

item.title: UFYB 130: The What If Parade
item.itunes:title: The What If Parade
item.description:
I know all of you will be able to relate to having moments where your brain seems to go to worst-case scenarios; where you imagine all the horrible things that could potentially happen in your life, or what I call a “what-if parade.” Even though I’ve dedicated my life to the practice of thought work, I’m no exception, and today, I’m showing you why this is normal and what you can do when this happens.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/130
item.content:encoded:
I know all of you will be able to relate to having moments where your brain seems to go to worst-case scenarios; where you imagine all the horrible things that could potentially happen in your life, or what I call a “what-if parade.” Even though I’ve dedicated my life to the practice of thought work, I’m no exception, and today, I’m showing you why this is normal and what you can do when this happens.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/130
item.itunes:subtitle: The first step in understanding the difference between what is really happening and what you’re only imagining.

item.itunes:title: Creating Purpose Out of Chaos (Turn Panic Into Peace Series #11)
item.description:

If you’re not currently living the life you want, I’m sharing some reasons why all of us humans tend to turn away from what’s possible for us, and finally, what it takes to create the life of your dreams.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/purpose-peace-11

item.title: This Is Your Life (Turn Panic Into Peace Series #10)
item.itunes:title: This Is Your Life (Turn Panic Into Peace Series #10)
item.description:
Join me on this episode as I show you why humans tend to want to believe that our lives will start in the future, or that it will start once we have achieved something, whether that’s weight loss, finding a partner, or anything else. Putting your life off until things get back to ‘normal’ is preventing you from experiencing the freedom and happiness you could be having right now if you embraced your current situation, and I’m giving you the tools to help you do that today.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/your-life-peace-10
item.content:encoded:
Join me on this episode as I show you why humans tend to want to believe that our lives will start in the future, or that it will start once we have achieved something, whether that’s weight loss, finding a partner, or anything else. Putting your life off until things get back to ‘normal’ is preventing you from experiencing the freedom and happiness you could be having right now if you embraced your current situation, and I’m giving you the tools to help you do that today.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/your-life-peace-10
item.itunes:subtitle: How embracing your current circumstances now can give you freedom and happiness.
item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: Live Coaching: Relationships, Productivity & Health Anxiety During a Pandemic (Turn Panic Into Peace Series #9)
item.itunes:title: Live Coaching: Relationships, Productivity & Health Anxiety During a Pandemic (Turn Panic Into Peace Series #9)
item.description:
This is a time of questioning and being curious of your patterns, belief systems, and actions that you’ve been able to escape from before the pandemic, and you’re going to see how it shows up for three of my clients. We’re addressing questions around living your best life right now, health anxiety, perfectionist tendencies, and getting things done in quarantine.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/live-coaching-peace-9
item.content:encoded:
This is a time of questioning and being curious of your patterns, belief systems, and actions that you’ve been able to escape from before the pandemic, and you’re going to see how it shows up for three of my clients. We’re addressing questions around living your best life right now, health anxiety, perfectionist tendencies, and getting things done in quarantine.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/live-coaching-peace-9
item.itunes:subtitle: How this pandemic is mirroring the work we’ve all been trying to avoid doing.
item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 128: Boredom
item.itunes:title: Boredom
item.description:
Join me this week as I talk through what boredom actually is, whether it’s a problem, and how you can handle it better. Letting boredom just exist in your body can feel extremely uncomfortable, but you’ll be surprised at how much growth and new insights you’ll discover on the other side of it.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/128
item.content:encoded:
Join me this week as I talk through what boredom actually is, whether it’s a problem, and how you can handle it better. Letting boredom just exist in your body can feel extremely uncomfortable, but you’ll be surprised at how much growth and new insights you’ll discover on the other side of it.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/128
item.itunes:subtitle: Why nothing is intrinsically boring.
item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: Health Anxiety, Hyper-Vigilance, & Yes-And Thoughts (Turn Panic Into Peace Series #8)
item.itunes:title: Health Anxiety, Hyper-Vigilance, & Yes-And Thoughts (Turn Panic Into Peace Series #8)
item.description:
Listen in today as I offer you three tools that I have found to be very helpful in my own life and with my clients with their health-related anxiety. Acknowledging the reality that you are mortal is the first step in finding peace with our current situation, and I’m walking you through how you can use these techniques to stay out of frenzy and anxiety.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/health-anxiety-peace-8

item.title: Money Mindset & Financial Anxiety (Turn Panic into Peace Series #7)
item.itunes:title: Money Mindset & Financial Anxiety (Turn Panic into Peace Series #7)
item.description:
Listen in today as I show you why you can create value and money right now during a pandemic. Just because this is our current reality doesn’t mean you don’t have any control over your mind or the kind of results you can create anymore. I guarantee that taking ownership of your thoughts and choosing intentional thoughts around money will help you feel empowered and create any amount of money or value you want.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/money-anxiety-peace-7

item.title: Brain Habits & How to Change Them (Turn Panic Into Peace Series #6)
item.itunes:title: Brain Habits & How to Change Them (Turn Panic Into Peace Series #6)
item.description:
Listen in this week as I show you how your brain creates mental habits, and how cognitive bias is a crucial element to understand in changing them. This concept is applicable everywhere in your life, at any time, and the two ways I’m offering to you today of how to prevent your cognitive bias from running wild is going to give you so much more control over your mental and emotional experience.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/brain-habits-peace-6

item.title: UFYB 127: How to Know What You Want
item.itunes:title: How to Know What You Want
item.description:
Join me this week as I break down what it means to want something, the fundamental motivation for why you want something if you have an unmanaged mind, and two exercises you can use to determine what you actually want. I’ll also be diving into how women especially use thought work against themselves in deciding what they want for their lives.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/127

item.title: Creating Productivity + Connection (Turn Panic into Peace Series #5)
item.itunes:title: Creating Productivity + Connection (Turn Panic into Peace Series #5)
item.description:
In the midst of what feels like chaos and frenzy, most of us are seeking some stability and familiarity. Staying focused and productive in some area of your life and feeling connected to other people are two ways of doing this, and I’m offering my recommendations of how you can do this reasonably and realistically.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/productivity-peace-5

item.itunes:title: Why Mental Health Matters Most (Turn Panic into Peace Series #4)
item.description:
Join me on this episode as I highlight why your mental health matters the most right now. You’ll discover what is possible for you when you prioritize this over your physical state, and how undermining it is actually deteriorating both your body and mind.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/mental-health-peace-4

item.title: How to Feel Better (Turn Panic Into Peace Series #3)
item.itunes:title: How to Feel Better (Turn Panic Into Peace Series #3)
item.description:
Join me as I walk you through the difference between your thoughts and your feelings, and how to identify what a feeling is. From there, you’ll be able to start the process of intentionally creating emotions that you want to feel, and at the same time, you’ll be able to allow emotions that feel uncomfortable in your body without resisting them.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/feel-better-peace-3
item.content:encoded:
Join me as I walk you through the difference between your thoughts and your feelings, and how to identify what a feeling is. From there, you’ll be able to start the process of intentionally creating emotions that you want to feel, and at the same time, you’ll be able to allow emotions that feel uncomfortable in your body without resisting them.

item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 126: Anxiety and Control
item.itunes:title: Anxiety and Control
item.description:
Discover exactly why we get sucked into believing that we can control other people and external circumstances, and why letting it go is the only path to true freedom. Any feeling you want to have can be achieved by relinquishing the belief that you can or should be able to control anything outside of yourself. To do this, I’m offering a set of questions you can ask yourself that will focus on the things you can control.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/126
item.content:encoded:
Discover exactly why we get sucked into believing that we can control other people and external circumstances, and why letting it go is the only path to true freedom. Any feeling you want to have can be achieved by relinquishing the belief that you can or should be able to control anything outside of yourself. To do this, I’m offering a set of questions you can ask yourself that will focus on the things you can control.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/126
item.itunes:subtitle: A more useful set of questions to ask yourself rather than trying to control other people or the world.
item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: Neutralize Your Negative Thoughts (Turn Panic Into Peace Series #2)
item.itunes:title: Neutralize Your Negative Thoughts (Turn Panic Into Peace Series #2)
item.description:
Too often, we believe that the thoughts we have are unchangeable, and so we try to control everything outside of us to try to feel better, which is impossible. Instead, what I’m offering you today is a technique called neutral thoughts that will guide you in actively choosing thoughts that serve you.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/neutralize-peace-2

item.title: Your Brain In A Pandemic (Turn Panic Into Peace Series #1)
item.itunes:title: Your Brain In A Pandemic (Turn Panic Into Peace Series #1)
item.description:
Join me today to gain a deeper understanding of what is going on in your brain right now. This first step is crucial to changing the state of panic that you might be experiencing. I’ll also be highlighting how the news and social media can feed into the frenzy that your mind is going through.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/pandemic-peace-1

item.itunes:title: Choose Your Own Adventure
item.description:
Join me this week to discover how you might be disempowering yourself by not embracing the agency you have over your own life. There is no right or wrong, failure or success. You can have any adventure you want, and there is no wrong story to write.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/125

item.itunes:title: UFYB Bonus: Pandemic Panic (UPDATED)
item.description:
Join me as I share some tools that you can practice to help you see why you might be feeling fear right now, as well as some reminders about the news and social media and the role it plays in your mental health. Acting out of fear will always feel terrible, and so I’m sharing my pandemic mission statement and some affirmations that you can use too, to help you be in control of your brain and manage your thoughts.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/pandemic-panic/

item.title: UFYB 124: Self-Improvement Shame
item.itunes:title: Self-Improvement Shame
item.description:
Join me this week as I introduce you to a concept I call self-improvement shame. Coming to this work with shame about yourself, to change your own negative thoughts about yourself, is never going to produce the change you want to see. You can’t outrun your shame, and so instead, I’m showing you how to start creating true transformation in the long-run.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/124
item.content:encoded:
Join me this week as I introduce you to a concept I call self-improvement shame. Coming to this work with shame about yourself, to change your own negative thoughts about yourself, is never going to produce the change you want to see. You can’t outrun your shame, and so instead, I’m showing you how to start creating true transformation in the long-run.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/124
item.itunes:subtitle: How we sometimes have mixed motivations for changing something in our lives or ourselves.
item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 123: Your Brain on Patriarchy
item.itunes:title: Your Brain on Patriarchy
item.description:
Discover the true impact of patriarchy on our brains through the concept of heuristics. I'm giving you the basics of how our brain unconsciously absorbs the messages we’re taught and creates reasoning shortcuts, and then how that ties into the patriarchy and our experience as people socialized as women.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/123
item.content:encoded:
Discover the true impact of patriarchy on our brains through the concept of heuristics. item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 122: Silver Linings + Positive Spin
item.itunes:title: Silver Linings + Positive Spin
item.description:
As you learn about thought work and start using these tools to change your life, it’s only natural to want to speed things up, change all of your beliefs, and start getting the results you want right away. Something I’ve seen every single one of my students do at some point is ‘silver-lining’ their thoughts to feel better, and today I’m showing you how this isn’t conducive to the process and why it doesn’t work.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/122
item.content:encoded:

item.itunes:title: Five Years of Thought Work Part 3: Friendships and My Self-Relationship

Join me this week to discover how practicing the skill of managing your mind can be the greatest gift you can give yourself. I’m now more kind and compassionate to myself in moments of intense suffering and negativity, and you too will get to see the transformations that are truly possible if you apply this work.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/121

item.itunes:title: Five Years of Thought Work Part 1: Body, Work & Money
item.description:
On today’s episode, I’m diving into my relationship with my body image, work, and money mindset, and how that has shifted over the years of doing this work. A lot has changed since I first started in 2015, and I’m sharing the progress I’ve seen in those areas, as well as the habitual thought patterns that occasionally still show up.

item.title: UFYB 118: Empathy & Other People’s Models
item.itunes:title: Empathy & Other People’s Models
item.description:
Listen in today to gain a new perspective on why it’s so hard to fundamentally understand that other people have totally different thoughts to you, and how you buy into the assumptions you have about what’s going on in their brain. If you don’t know what a model is, I’m giving you the basics to help you understand this concept better, and I’m also sharing my interpretation of what empathy really means.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/118

item.title: UFYB 114: Wanting Vs. Having or the Pleasure of Desire
item.itunes:title: Wanting Vs. Having or the Pleasure of Desire
item.description:
This week, I’m diving into the basic premise of desire and why changing how we think about it can be so transformational. We tend to want to push this feeling away when we can’t have something, or rush to acquire the object of our desires if we can have it, but I want to suggest a new way to approach this feeling.

Get full show notes and more information here: http://unfuckyourbrain.com/114
item.content:encoded:

We tend to want to push this feeling away when we can’t have something, or rush to acquire the object of our desires if we can have it, but I want to suggest a new way to approach this feeling.

In fact, you can discover a whole new way of using thought work and stretch yourself in ways you never would have imagined.

item.title: UFYB 104: Performance Anxiety
item.itunes:title: Performance Anxiety
item.description:
It can be absolutely crippling and produce more anxiety than necessary, especially when we preemptively think about how we’ll feel when we have to get out there and perform. So this week, I’m approaching this concept from a slightly different perspective to show you what it really is, how we often exacerbate this negative feeling, and how to start resolving it.

Get full show notes and more information here: http://unfuckyourbrain.com/104

item.title: UFYB 103: Abundance & Scarcity
item.itunes:title: Abundance & Scarcity
item.description:
If there are things you want to achieve in your life or business but you’re worried about the expense, or not having enough time, or whether it’ll all work perfectly the way you imagine, today’s episode is for you. I’m highlighting these thoughts that have been running in your mind day in and day out, to help you look at them, and decide if you want to keep them.

Get full show notes and more information here: http://unfuckyourbrain.com/103
item.content:encoded:

item.title: UFYB 102: Internal Bias & Being a Better Ally
item.itunes:title: UFYB 102: Internal Bias & Being a Better Ally
item.description:
In this episode, I’m outlining my beliefs on internalized biases. We all have them, whether we’re conscious of them or not, as we live in a society where people have explicitly or implicitly taught us certain biases. It can be difficult to accept the thoughts we deem to be wrong or ugly that we’ve internalized about ourselves or others, but rejecting them is far from useful.

Get full show notes and more information here: http://unfuckyourbrain.com/102
item.content:encoded:
In this episode, I’m outlining my beliefs on internalized biases. We all have them, whether we’re conscious of them or not, as we live in a society where people have explicitly or implicitly taught us certain biases. It can be difficult to accept the thoughts we deem to be wrong or ugly that we’ve internalized about ourselves or others, but rejecting them is far from useful.

Get full show notes and more information here: http://unfuckyourbrain.com/102
item.itunes:subtitle: How you might be keeping yourself stuck in your biased thoughts by trying to change them.
item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 101: The Human Ecosystem
item.itunes:title: The Human Ecosystem
item.description:
The human ecosystem is a concept that I developed early on in my own thought work journey when I was trying to change the behaviors I didn’t like in the people around me - especially my partner at the time - but keep the ones I did. Sound familiar? Today, I’m taking a deep dive into this concept to show you how it applies to anyone in your life, including yourself, or any circumstance you experience.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/101
item.content:encoded:
The human ecosystem is a concept that I developed early on in my own thought work journey when I was trying to change the behaviors I didn’t like in the people around me - especially my partner at the time - but keep the ones I did. Sound familiar? Today, I’m taking a deep dive into this concept to show you how it applies to anyone in your life, including yourself, or any circumstance you experience.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/101
item.itunes:subtitle: How tinkering with aspects you don’t like of someone and keeping the ones you do is not an option.
item.itunes:author: Kara Loewentheil

item.title: UFYB 100: The Infinite 1%
item.itunes:title: The Infinite 1%
item.description:
Join me this week to discover how the infinite 1% tool can shift your mindset completely. The difference between not doing anything and doing something 1% is huge so I hope you embrace it and start implementing this in your life because you will see some amazing transformations.

Get full show notes and more information here: http://unfuckyourbrain.com/100
item.content:encoded:

item.title: UFYB 99: Fear and Safety
item.itunes:title: Fear and Safety
item.description:
Join me this week as I break down the way we process the feelings of safety and danger. These feelings are no exception to thought work, and it’s something we need to work on to teach our lizard brains that our perception of our safety is our responsibility and can be managed.

Get full show notes and more information here: http://unfuckyourbrain.com/99

item.itunes:title: Listener Q&A Vol. 14

item.title: UFYB 97: Unconscious Commitments
item.itunes:title: Unconscious Commitments
item.description:
Do you ever find yourself consciously committing to a new goal or habit and then failing at it? I think everyone can relate to, at some point or another, trying to do something new and it seemingly just not working out. This week, I’m introducing you to a concept I call unconscious commitments; understanding this is going to be life-changing in getting more clarity on why you sometimes have a hard time achieving your goals.

Get full show notes and more information here: http://unfuckyourbrain.com/97

item.title: UFYB 96: Beginner’s Mind
item.itunes:title: Beginner’s Mind
item.description:
This week, I’m introducing you to a concept I first learned in yoga – beginner’s mind. I’m all about growth and evolution, and as humans, we naturally want to advance in anything we do. With that in mind, I’m delving into why learning to cultivate the beginner’s mind is crucial to actually improving your skills and advancing in your abilities.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/96

item.title: UFYB 95: Aging Anxiety
item.itunes:title: Aging Anxiety
item.description:
On this episode, I'm diving into why some of us - mostly women - struggle with the reality of aging. I'm exploring all factors, from our cultural stories and stereotypes to the archetypes of women that play into our identities as we move through different stages of life.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/95

item.title: UFYB 94: Thought Avoidance
item.itunes:title: Thought Avoidance
item.description:
We're desperate to run away from old thoughts that make us feel bad, and I'm going to help you see if you're frantically trying to drive your brain in a new direction. Today, I'm showing you how you can give yourself a fighting chance to truly change your thoughts by squarely looking them in the eye.

Get full show notes and more information here: http://unfuckyourbrain.com/94

item.title: UFYB 93: Problem-Addiction
item.itunes:title: Problem-Addiction
item.description:
Discover how you might be subconsciously sabotaging whatever problem you're facing. I'm sharing why this is actually normal and how you can start to solve it for good. Working through this is truly one of the keys to unlocking the possibilities of your own life, so come join us in The Clutch if you need more support on this topic!

Get full show notes and more information here: http://unfuckyourbrain.com/93

item.title: UFYB 92: Numbing + Compulsive Behavior Vol. 2
item.itunes:title: Numbing + Compulsive Behavior Vol. 2
item.description:
I've got two tools that are seemingly straightforward in helping you break any of your ingrained numbing habits, but it's going to require lots of practice in order to use them to your advantage. Breaking habituated patterns takes effort because most of the time it's happening unconsciously, and it often makes us feel anxious when we act against our own will, which is why these tools are going to be challenging but life-changing.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/92

item.title: UFYB 91: Numbing + Compulsive Behavior Vol. 1
item.itunes:title: Numbing + Compulsive Behavior Vol. 1
item.description:
Working on bringing awareness to compulsive behaviors means being able to enjoy these activities mindfully, without the end goal of numbing. I'm focusing on the distinction that exists, and why we feel the need to get a break from our feelings, which is totally normal. Stay tuned because next week, I'll be teaching you how to start changing these habits if you want to.

item.title: UFYB 90: Perfectionist Fantasies + Tomorrow Thinking
item.itunes:title: Perfectionist Fantasies + Tomorrow Thinking
item.description:
This week, I'm addressing perfectionist fantasies and tomorrow thinking. I'm discussing how they work, why we indulge in them, and the consequences of staying stuck in this cycle. If there is any area of your life you're working to better or achieve something in and it isn't working, I can guarantee that this is probably the reason why. I urge you to listen to this episode closely, a few times over if necessary, to stop making plans you know you won't keep. 

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/90

item.itunes:title: How to Increase Your Productivity
item.description:
This week, I'm helping you see why you're not getting as much done as you'd like and how to deal with the discomfort of having to actually practice focusing in your daily life.

If productivity and multitasking are things that are holding you back, this episode is for you. It's not going to be easy, but try out my tips for focusing today and I can guarantee your life is going to be transformed.

There are areas of this particular feeling that we're apt to misinterpret, so hopefully, this episode gives you some insight into how you might just be thinking about it in an unhelpful way.

item.title: UFYB 86: Trauma
item.itunes:title: Trauma
item.description:
Today, I'm digging into the idea of PTSD and something you may not have heard of before - post-traumatic growth. I'm giving you a clear description of what trauma actually is and how you can help yourself get through it. There are some really important key points I'm sharing today that will help you work towards emotional resiliency to change your experiences going forward.

item.title: UFYB 85: Parenting
item.itunes:title: Parenting
item.description:
Trying to find the balance in dealing with a child, while setting boundaries and expectations can be tricky, especially because you can't control their behavior - even if you think you can. Join me this week as I outline the three key points to consider when setting boundaries with your kids so you can be a parent without all the emotional drama that comes along with being one!

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/85

item.title: UFYB 84: Talking to Yourself
item.itunes:title: Talking to Yourself
item.description:
Dr. James Gills is a brilliant ocular surgeon who said, "I talk to myself more than I listen to myself," and when I heard this, it stopped me in my tracks. Most of us know that listening to others usually does us good, but we don't realize that we also often listen to what our brain tells us to think. Today, I want to shed some light on how you can start to talk to your brain in a proactive way that will positively change the discourse in your mind.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/84

Today, I want to shed some light on how you can start to talk to your brain in a proactive way that will positively change the discourse in your mind.

item.description:

item.title: UFYB 80: Judgment V. Curiosity
item.itunes:title: Judgment V. Curiosity
item.description:
On today's episode, I break down why judgment is not serving you, especially as you embark on your thought work journey, and how practicing curiosity instead will open you to a much richer experience. The difference between judging your thoughts and having curiosity is a huge shift: curiosity doesn’t assume to know the answer. Curiosity doesn’t evaluate if something is good or bad. Curiosity doesn’t have an opinion. Curiosity pays attention. 

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/80

Join The Clutch today for a community of like-minded feminists: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/theclutch/

item.title: Level Up Your Thought Work with The Clutch
item.itunes:title: Level Up Your Thought Work with The Clutch
item.description:
Introducing: The Clutch. An online feminist coaching community where you can learn how to create true, authentic confidence in your own heart and mind - and bond with other bad-ass women who are doing the same.

The world is always coming at you, with new challenges. But now you have somewhere to go. Anytime. Anywhere. For anything. And a community that has your back.

Because you’re always going to be a woman in a society built by and for men. You’re always going to need advice, feedback and support in changing your thought patterns, navigating the world, and creating your best life.

Because a good clutch goes with any outfit and holds all the essentials you need. Because clutch is exactly what you need exactly when you need it. And the Clutch is exactly what your brain needs, whenever you need it. Conversations that dig deep. A community that helps you grow.

Visit to https://unfuckyourbrain.com/theclutch sign up!

item.title: UFYB 76: Anger + Something New
item.itunes:title: Anger + Something New
item.description:
On a previous episode, I talked about the distinction between positive and negative motivation and action, and the way we're taught that negative emotions lead to positive actions. Many of us think our anger will motivate us to take actions, believing this will change things, but I'm hoping to share some insight that will shed a little light on why this is a mistaken thought pattern.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfuckyourbrain.com/76

item.title: UFYB 74: 100 Episode Review - A- Work, Let it Be Easy, and Compound Interest
item.itunes:title: 100 Episode Review - A- Work, Let it Be Easy, and Compound Interest

item.title: UFYB 67: The Struggle Bus (How to Deal with Negative Emotions)
item.itunes:title: The Struggle Bus (How to Deal with Negative Emotions)
item.description:
You don't have to change your negative thoughts right away - it's okay to sit with them for a bit. I like to call this the Struggle Bus. You might be struggling with some negative emotion, but you're still moving forward. You're still showing up to do everything you need to do.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfckyourbrain.com/67

item.description:

Believing new things on purpose is work. It's going to feel like work. That's the good news. Because the good news is if it feels terrible sometimes, you're doing it right.

item.title: UFYB 60: Jealousy & Envy
item.itunes:title: Jealousy & Envy
item.description:
In this episode, I talk about the differences between jealousy and envy and how they relate to other emotions. They both hinge on the thought that you need something external - money, a certain job, a romantic partner, a friend - to be happy and that you will be unhappy without it. Join me today to hear why confidence alone won't solve issues with jealousy.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfckyourbrain.com/60
item.content:encoded:

item.title: UFYB 56: How Rejection Holds You Back in Business and Dating
item.itunes:title: How Rejection Holds You Back in Business and Dating
item.description:
Join me today for a tough look at how so many of us are letting our fears of shame and rejection keep us from putting ourselves out there enough to reach our goals. I can't tell you how many "no"s you need to hear but I can say that every no gets you closer to the "yes" you want and the only thing holding you back is your unwillingness to hear the no.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfckyourbrain.com/56

item.description:
Today, I want to teach you more in-depth about people-pleasing and why I think we should stop using that terminology. Join me today for People-Pleasing 2.0 and discover how this behavior sabotages your authenticity and perpetuates dishonest relationships. Plus, I share a couple of steps to ending this deceptive cycle. Awareness is key, my chickens. Notice your thoughts and you can change them!

item.description:

Listen in as I reveal how you might be blocking yourself from fully enjoying your friendships – then I’ll tell you what you can do to flip this script and appreciate the many friendships the world can offer you if you just know where to look.

item.description:

And on this episode, I am excited to show you how you can properly use constraint in your life to create more time, hit big milestones, and level up any area of your life.

item.title: UFYB 44: Catastrophizing
item.itunes:title: Catastrophizing
item.description:
This week, I want to talk to you about the concept of catastrophizing, or imagining all the possible future negative scenarios that could happen and emotionally reacting as if they were real. We take a look at why we do this and how it impacts the results we have in our life. I share three simple but powerful tools that will help you kick your catastrophizing habit to the curb.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfckyourbrain.com/44
item.content:encoded:

item.title: UFYB 43: Why Restriction Doesn't Work
item.itunes:title: Why Restriction Doesn't Work
item.description:
On this episode, we take a look at why restricting yourself from having or doing something that you want – whether it’s food, alcohol, or spending – does not work. Join me as I show you how to change your thinking from restriction mode to the type of thinking that will help you achieve the positive results you desire in all areas of your life.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfckyourbrain.com/43

item.description:
I get a lot of emails, Facebook, and Instagram messages from you guys. And although I love to hear from all of you, due to the sheer volume of these messages, I can’t respond to all of them directly. So today, I’m answering some of your questions and exploring the topics that you’d like to get coached on. For this episode, I’ve chosen questions and topics that many of you struggle with and I think all of you will learn from.

item.title: UFYB 41: Drama & Toxic People
item.itunes:title: Drama & Toxic People
item.description:
On this episode, we take a look at the reality behind drama and who really causes it in your life. I explain why you should actually consider spending more time with people who you think affect your vibe and show you exactly what you need to do to totally escape drama and toxic people with only a small change.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfckyourbrain.com/41

item.title: UFYB 40: Reactivity Vs. Resilience
item.itunes:title: Reactivity Vs. Resilience
item.description:
Are you usually emotionally exhausted by the end of the day? Do you obsess over whether other people are upset with you (even if there’s no actual evidence to support it)? If you can relate to any of the above, it’s a sign that you don’t have appropriate boundaries and you don’t have emotional resilience.  Discover whether you’re emotionally reactive to what’s going on around you and how it may be affecting your day-to-day.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfckyourbrain.com/40
item.content:encoded:

item.itunes:subtitle: How you can begin building emotional resilience in your life

item.title: UFYB 39: Reaching Your Potential
item.itunes:title: Reaching Your Potential
item.description:
I believe that most people misunderstand what potential is and what it actually means. This is a deep topic that has a lot of ramifications for how we think about the past and the future and what we can achieve in our lives. Listen in as we take a look at the difference between being past-focused and future-focused and how each approach affects the results you see in your life.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfckyourbrain.com/39
item.content:encoded:

item.title: UFYB 38: How to Choose New Thoughts
item.itunes:title: How to Choose New Thoughts
item.description:
You probably already accept the idea that not all of your thoughts are true. With that in mind, what should you believe? On this episode, I explain why no one can tell you want to think and share a quite counterintuitive framework for evaluating thoughts and deciding whether you want to believe them. I then show you how you can come up with your own new helpful thoughts that are in line with your goals.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfckyourbrain.com/38

item.title: UFYB 37: Self Love 2.0
item.itunes:title: Self Love 2.0
item.description:
Listen in as we take a look at three thought errors that are running in the back of your mind, holding you back from working on your emotional health and making progress. Join me as I show you how you can make a few simple mindset shifts that will deeply enrich not only your life but the lives of those around you. 

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfckyourbrain.com/37

item.title: UFYB 36: Antidotes to Perfectionism (Other Focus + Minimum Baseline)
item.itunes:title: Antidotes to Perfectionism (Other Focus + Minimum Baseline)
item.description:
A couple of weeks ago, we talked about perfectionism and how so many of us love to make unrealistic plans and never keep them or see them through to the end. This week, I want to take a deeper dive into the topic of perfectionism – the insidious trait that many smart people suffer from – and look at two powerful tools for managing it.

Get full show notes and more information here: https://unfckyourbrain.com/36
